data.description: Contemporary theory of consumption, production, pricing and resource allocation.
data.title: INTERMEDIATE MICROECONOMIC THEORY

data.description: Introduction to data analysis for social scientists using spreadsheets software - with specific applications to economics, business and finance - including data management and manipulation; formulas and calculations; data visualization and presentation using charts and graphics; statistical and visual analysis of economic indicators using tables, functions, graphs and descriptive statistics; and optimization of functions with economic and financial data.
data.title: INTRODUCTION TO DATA ANALYSIS USING SPREADSHEETS

data.description: Includes a sequential study of subject material in agribusiness management and managerial economics related to the management of agricultural businesses. Topics related to agribusiness management in the U.S., including organizational structure, marketing, strategy, financial statements, financing and production planning. Concepts from managerial economics as applied to the agribusiness firm, including production theory, cost analysis, pricing strategies, cost-benefit analysis, investment decisions and competition strategies.
data.title: AGRIBUSINESS ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT

data.description: Integrated treatment of macroeconomics and microeconomics (seeECON 101andECON 102). Accelerated approach to economics training, especially for Economics: Math Emphasis majors.
data.title: PRINCIPLES OF ECONOMICS-ACCELERATED TREATMENT

data.description: Economic problems of individuals, firms and industries with emphasis on value, price, and distribution of income.
data.title: PRINCIPLES OF MICROECONOMICS

data.description: A mathematical approach to the theory of consumption, production, pricing and resource allocation.
data.title: INTERMEDIATE MICROECONOMIC THEORY - ADVANCED TREATMENT
